name: The Inn on Broadway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even though this B & B is a few more dollars(about$30) from the Palace Hotel-it is the only place to stay. The Inn at Broadway is impeccable. It is so clean & well taken care of.
reviews.title: The ONLY place to stay in Silver City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gardens are perfect. The hostess Sandy couldn't be more accomodating. We had to shorten our stay due to business . Although we know it was a hardship, she was very flexible by not charging us. There are snacks for guests during the day and lots of attention to details. The breakfast was the best we had during our weeks' stay in N. Mexico. After being 25 years in the travel business and many trips later, I know a great accomodation when I experience it. The location is perfect-right in downtown but very quiet since it's at the end of block. When in Silver City, stay here!
reviews.title: Wonderful Historic House Plus Hospitality

reviews.text: The Inn is a beautiful but not stuffy B & B where you will lack for nothing. The upbeat owner,Sandy, will orient you and give you advice and directions for local attractions: hiking, ruins, museums, etc., and fix you a great breakfast to get your day started. We stayed there with two other couples and it was very easy to make ourselves at home in one of the two parlors. There are great restaurants within walking distance. We especially liked the 1ZERO6 just two short blocks away.
reviews.title: Best Place to Stay in Silver City!"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sandy was very accommodating and sent us off with hot coffee, and breakfast when we headed out. She even sent us clothing we had left behind in a drawer.
reviews.title: A nice inn

reviews.text: My granddaughter and I stayed in the Hummingbird Suite and sweet it was! The room was cheery, classy, and just the right size for she and I. The Owner was very friendly and funny plus a great cook. The location is superb, just a short walk to Historic downtown. We will come back and stay here again.
reviews.title: I could live here...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 30 day road trip that included Silver City and the Inn on Broadway. This is definitely the place to stay, just like home. Received good recommendations from Sandra on side trips, and then found out Ron was (like me) an old Navy man.
reviews.title: You can't go wrong here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The home is a couple of short blocks from the main drag, but far enough away to avoid noise and traffic.
reviews.title: Perfectly charming, clean, quiet, comfortable lodging in a great little town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If we are ever in the vicinity, would definitely return to the Inn on Broadway.
reviews.title: Two real nice people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being a B and B owner myself, my husband and I were on a bus man's holiday for a few days and stumbled upon the Inn on Broadway. We were looking for something close to downtown where we could park and walk and not fight traffic (ya, right, in a dinky little town like Silver City.). We were traveling with our service dog, Rags, so it was really important that all 3 of us would be comfortable--and we were!!! The house is lovely, the appointments are just right--not too stuffy, over-doilied or stark and simple. We stayed in Gram's room and she musta been quite a gal because the bed was so comfortable that we forgot to turn the TV on and just lounged around and read as many of the available magazines and great books that were there as we could. This is an unheard of event for my husband. What a delight! we slept the sleep of the tired traveler. Breakfast was hand made--wonderful taste blends of Hatch chilies and maple syrup (yippeee) in an intimate dining room where the 4 tables of guests got to know each other. Just a recommendation, tho, maybe a little bit of music would keep the silences from being so silent. Terrible little complaint, but heck, if that's as bad as it gets things are pretty darn good.
reviews.title: Lovely room, great breakfast, fine folks at this Inn
An enchanting experience in the land of enchantment
reviews.text: the house itself is such a solid blast from the past with high ceilings, fire places, lovely wall paper and window treatments and the owners have done such a nice job of making everything look just so very lovely! and our service dog, Rags, who doesn't get around too much any more, seemed to perk up and enjoy herself as well.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in the jacuzzi room and enjoyed our stay. Great breakfast and location.
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our second stay in one year. We drove thru Silver City a year ago, stopped for lunch, and stayed 4 days! Have stayed in other places around Silver City since, but this is our favorite. It has a homey private feel. The location is about a block from the main street, Bullard Street, so it's a nice walk to see the art galleries and shops.
reviews.title: We love it!

reviews.text: We feel relaxed, comfortable, and know that we can turn to the hosts, Sandy & Ron, for advise on where to eat or explore. The rooms are very clean and nicely decorated with antiques. We've always enjoyed fellow guests that we meet in the mornings at breakfast. The breakfasts, by the way, are very good. The hosts can cater to just about every taste.
reviews.title: Beautiful Inn and wonderful hospitality
Felt very uncomfortable
reviews.text: Great place! We'll be back!
The Inn on Broadway is a beautiful B & B. Not knowing much about the history of Silver City, it was a pleasant experience and we enjoyed the historic environment that the inn displays.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a night at The Inn on Broadway 2 years ago and loved it. For this year's trip, we chose to stay in the Gram room. It was large, well apppointed and completely comfortable. This beautifully restored Victorian is perfectly located in the Historic District - an easy walk to sights, shopping - theater and eating!
reviews.title: Once more - a charming visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We shall return.
reviews.title: Great location and very comfortable. Delicious breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Hummingbird room which was very comfortable and quiet. This B&B is a block from the downtown area, so you are able to leave your car and walk throughout the town, and there are some wonderful stores and galleries to be seen. Sandy, one of the owners, prepared a fabulous breakfast for us...baked eggs, pouched pears, and homemade bread and muffins. We enjoyed our 2 night stay.
reviews.title: Best place to stay in Silver City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything lived up to the reviews we read before trying this B & B. The breakfasts were excellent, the room and common areas were very clean and the bed was fine. We can see why Sandra has so many repeat visitors.
reviews.title: Wonderfull

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Inn was very clean and comfortable. We were under a lot off stress with the trip and it was nice to end the day with a serene place to wind down. Sandra was great and was very knowledgeable with the town. The food was great.
reviews.title: A great place to stay

description: The Inn on Broadway is located within the Historic Downtown of Silver City, New Mexico. Our rooms are spacious and our homemade breakfasts delicious. We are an easy walk to restaurants, galleries and the Silver City Museum. You can also enjoy day trips to the Gila Cliff Dwellings, the Catwalk and the City of Rocks. Hiking, biking and birding are always available within the 3.3 million acres of the Gila National Wilderness.
